`awk '!seen[$0]++' ~/.tmux.conf > ~/.tmu: Clean up duplicates with `awk '!seen[$0]++' ~/.tmux.conf > ~/.tmux.conf.clean && mv ~/.tmux.conf.clean ~/.tmux.conf` and reload.
`Ctrl`을 누른 채 `b`를 입력하고 손을 뗀 다음 `c`를 눌러 w: It also passes if you hold down `Ctrl`, type `b`, release it, and then press `c` to create a window and then run the confirmation command. (`Ctrl+b` then `c`)
`Ctrl+b` 후 `c` 또는 `Ctrl+b` 후 `w`를 1회 실행해: Press `Ctrl+b` then `c`, or `Ctrl+b` then `w`, once and include the shortcut path.
`git -C <path> rev-parse --abbrev-ref HE: Check each session branch with `git -C <path> rev-parse --abbrev-ref HEAD`.

`prefix + r` 입력 시 `tmux.conf reloaded` 메: When entering `prefix + r`, the message `tmux.conf reloaded` is displayed.
`tailscale ping host`가 응답하고 접속 가능한 경로가 표: `tailscale ping host` responds and accessible paths are displayed.
`tailscale ssh user@host 'tmux ls'`에서 `w: Check `work` session on `tailscale ssh user@host 'tmux ls'`
`tailscale status`에서 대상 호스트가 Online 상태: Target host is Online in `tailscale status`
`tmux attach -t work`로 재접속해 이름 변경 세션으로 복: Reconnect with `tmux attach -t work` and return to the renamed session.
`tmux choose-tree -Z`를 실행해 트리 탐색을 열어 보세요: Run `tmux choose-tree -Z` to open the tree navigation.
`tmux command-prompt -p \"cmd\"`를 실행해 명령: Run `tmux command-prompt -p "cmd"` to open a command prompt.
`tmux copy-mode` 후 검색을 실행해 매치가 있는 키워드를 찾: After `tmux copy-mode`, run a search to find matching keywords.
`tmux detach-client` 후 `tmux attach -t w: Run `tmux detach-client`, then reattach with `tmux attach -t work`.
`tmux display-message -p \"#S:#I.#P\"`로: Check your current location with `tmux display-message -p "#S:#I.#P"`.
`tmux join-pane -hb -s :.3 -t :.0`처럼 오른쪽: Move the bottom-right pane to the first column, for example: `tmux join-pane -hb -s :.3 -t :.0`.
`tmux link-window -s aux:1 -t main:`로 병합: After merging with `tmux link-window -s aux:1 -t main:`, run `Ctrl+b` + `n` or `Ctrl+b` + `p` once to leave shortcut execution history.
You can check the current count with `tmux list-panes`.
`tmux list-panes`와 `tmux display-message: Check the applied state with `tmux list-panes` and `tmux display-message -p '#{window_layout}'`.
`tmux list-sessions`로 현재 상태를 직접 확인: Check the current status directly with `tmux list-sessions`
`tmux list-sessions`를 실행해 현재 세션 목록을 확인하세: Run `tmux list-sessions` to check the current session list.
If you see 2 or more in `tmux list-sessions`, you pass.
`tmux list-sessions`와 `tmux list-windows: Run `tmux list-sessions` and `tmux list-windows` in order to check current inventory first.
`tmux list-windows`에서 `dev` 이름이 보이는지 확인하: In `tmux list-windows`, make sure the name `dev` appears.
`tmux new -As main` → `tmux new-window -: Execute at once in the following order: `tmux new -As main` → `tmux new-window -n work` → `tmux list-windows`.
`tmux new-session -d -s aux` 후 `tmux new: After `tmux new-session -d -s aux`, create a source window with `tmux new-window -t aux -n audit`, then run `tmux link-window -s aux:1 -t main:`.
`tmux new-window -n logs`로 보조 window를 만든: Create a helper window with `tmux new-window -n logs`, then import a pane with `tmux join-pane -h -s :1.0 -t :0.0`.
`tmux new-window -n work`로 윈도우를 하나 더 만든: Create one more window with `tmux new-window -n work`, then select the current window.
`tmux rename-session -t main work`로 세션 이: Rename the session with `tmux rename-session -t main work`.
`tmux rename-session -t main work`를 실행한: Run `tmux rename-session -t main work`, then do one detach with `Ctrl+b` then `d`.
`tmux rename-session` 후 detach/attach로 같: After `tmux rename-session`, detach/attach to return to the same state.
`tmux rename-window dev`를 실행해 이름 변경을 먼저: Run `tmux rename-window dev` first to pass the rename step.
`tmux rename-window`와 `tmux list-windows: Identify the working window with `tmux rename-window` and `tmux list-windows`.
`tmux resize-pane -L 5`/`-R 5` 또는 `tmux: Adjust pane ratios with `tmux resize-pane -L 5`/`-R 5` or `tmux resize-pane -U 3`/`-D 3`.
`tmux show -g set-clipboard` 값을 확인하고 필요: Check `tmux show -g set-clipboard`, and if needed apply `set -g set-clipboard on`.
`tmux source-file ~/.tmux.conf`를 다시 실행하고: Run `tmux source-file ~/.tmux.conf` again and check with `tmux display-message -p '#S'` that the applicable session is correct.
`tmux split-window -h`, `tmux split-wind: Create 3 panes with `tmux split-window -h` and `tmux split-window -v`, then run `tmux select-layout even-horizontal` or `tmux select-layout tiled`.
`tmux split-window -h`와 `tmux split-wind: Try running `tmux split-window -h` and `tmux split-window -v` once each.
`tmux split-window` 실행 후 `Ctrl+b` + `%`: After executing `tmux split-window`, repeat the division into `Ctrl+b` + `%` or `Ctrl+b` + `"` one more time.

join은 `tmux join-pane -h -s :1.0 -t :0.0: Run join as a command like `tmux join-pane -h -s :1.0 -t :0.0`, and leave shortcut history by running one of `Ctrl+b` + `%` or `Ctrl+b` + `H/J/K/L` once.
join은 `tmux join-pane -hb -s :.3 -t :.0`: Run join as a command, for example `tmux join-pane -hb -s :.3 -t :.0`, and leave shortcut history by doing one of `Ctrl+b` + `%` or `Ctrl+b` + `H/J/K/L` once.

tmux는 터미널 작업을 세션으로 보존하고, 창과 패인을 통해 병렬 작업: tmux is a tool that preserves terminal tasks as sessions and allows stable operation of parallel tasks through windows and panes. This curriculum is designed so that even developers who are new to tmux can understand it through hands-on practice.
tmux는 하나의 터미널에서 여러 작업을 유지/전환하고, 연결이 끊겨도: tmux is a terminal multiplexer that allows you to maintain/switch multiple tasks on a single terminal and recover sessions if the connection is lost. First, read the official introduction, check the installation guide appropriate for your OS, and then start practicing.
tmux를 \"작업 복구와 연속성\" 도구로 이해하고, 이후 레슨에서 계: Understand tmux as a "task recovery and continuity" tool, and learn the basic verification routines (`tmux -V`, `tmux list-sessions`) that you will continue to use in later lessons.
tmux를 실전 운영 루틴으로 익히는 가장 빠른 학습 플로우: The fastest learning flow to learn tmux with practical operation routines
tmux를 쓰는 가장 큰 이유인 \"작업 복구\"를 다룹니다. 네트워크: It covers “task recovery,” which is the biggest reason for using tmux. Create operating habits that do not lose sessions even in network disconnection or terminal shutdown situations.

It covers “task recovery,” which is the biggest reason for using tmux. Create operating habits that do not lose sessions even in network disconnection or terminal shutdown situations. This lesson is about repeating the same task using shortcut keys to familiarize yourself with it.
tmux를 처음 켜보는 온램프 레슨입니다. SSH가 끊기거나 터미널을 닫: This is an onramp lesson for using tmux for the first time. Within 3 minutes, you can feel the core value of being able to continue working even if SSH is disconnected or the terminal is closed.
